channel.title: Current on Kramer Ecology Lab
channel.description: Recent content in Current on Kramer Ecology Lab

item.title: Austin Smith
item.description: Austin Joined the lab in November 2018 Austin completed both his B.A. (mathematics, 2013) and M.S. (interdisciplinary ecology, 2018) at the University of Florida. His research interests include implementing mathematical/statistical techniques to ecological data in order to understand species invasions, niche structure/ habitat suitability, and population dynamics. Austin’s previous research efforts involved model optimization techniques, utilizing machine learning algorithms for defining habitat quality of introduced game birds, and analyzing the effects of propagule size on release attempts.

item.title: Alexander Mercier
item.description: Alexander joined the lab in August 2018. Alexander Mercier is an undergraduate student at University of South Florida dual majoring in pure mathematics and microbiology, with a minor in Russian. His interests include disease ecology and its relation to epidemiology.

item.title: Lindsey Mixer
item.description: Lindsey joined the lab in June 2018. I completed my undergraduate degree in biology at Loyola University New Orleans. I am interested in population ecology and dynamics, aquatic ecology, invertebrates, and coding for data analysis.

item.title: Travis Flock
item.description: Travis joined the lab in 2018. I am mostly interested in reviewing and synthesizing published literature to conduct meta-analyses and database-driven research. My current Master’s thesis is using a meta-analysis to examine the costs of trait-mediated interactions and indirect effects relative to the density-mediated/consumptive effects of consumer-resource dynamics. Past research efforts that I have been involved in include, investigating the effects of octopamine in modulating defensive, antipredator behavior in scorpions, and using a database approach to investigate whether glucocorticoids in adult, wildlife populations were predictive of IUCN-labeled conservation status.

item.title: Fargam Neinavaie
item.description: Fargam joined the lab in 2018 and is developing a project on forecasting invasive species.
